# References and resources

Main sources for this course:

* [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) from Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund
* [Tidyverse documentation](https://www.tidyverse.org/)

More resources:

* RStudio [Cheat sheets](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/)
* Course on [computing for the social sciences](https://cfss.uchicago.edu/notes/problem-solving/)
* [Wrangling penguins: some basic data wrangling in R with `dplyr`](https://allisonhorst.shinyapps.io/dplyr-learnr/)
* [Be awesome in `ggplot2`](http://www.sthda.com/english/wiki/be-awesome-in-ggplot2-a-practical-guide-to-be-highly-effective-r-software-and-data-visualization)
* The course's material was made using [bookdown](https://bookdown.org/)
